fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4570].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a Request is created in Service Desk, Organization Members only receive a notification that the request is created and must opt in to receive additional updates by accessing the Customer Portal and clicking on *Get notifications*

_reference: [Managing Service Desk Notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/managing-service-desk-notifications-732528936.html#Managingservicedesknotifications-Howdifferentrolesreceivenotifications]_

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Organization Members to receive notifications by default and then opt-out
 
h3. Workaround 
Organization Member must opt-in to receive additional notifications clicking on *Get notifications* on the request
fields.summary: Send Notifications to Service Desk Organization Members By Default

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4569].
  {panel}

I have more than one organization of customers on a service desk, and they want different things.

If I turn off the rule, it affects all the organizations.

Or, maybe easier, if a user sets a request to "private" make that the default for subsequent request for that user until changed.

Thanks!

Jim
fields.summary: Make Service Desk Customer Notification "organization added" rule per organization, not per project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Currently when a customer/reporter belongs to two organization, creating requests via email will not add any organization to the request created.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add both organizations to the request.

Affects Cloud: JIRA v1000.610.2

Steps to reproduce:

- Open a board
- Click on a issue
- Press 'm'

Old behavior: A comment window would pop up
Current behavior: The cursor is moved to a comment box on the issue detail view (right panel)

It would be great to have the old behavior back

*Workaround* 

- Click on a issue
- Press '.' 
- Type 'Comment' and press enter.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4551].
  {panel}

h3. Context

Since [04 Jul 2016|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/what-s-new-686863216.html#What'sNew-servicedesk], SD Agents can now always create customer accounts in all JIRA Service Desk Cloud instances:
{quote}Agents can add new customers to a service desk regardless of how request permissions are configured. Agents can add new customers by inviting them from the Customers page, raising a request on their behalf, or adding them as request participants on an email request. Previously, agents could only add new customers to the service desk when the request security was set to 'anyone can create a customer account'.
{quote}
This has been a great feature.
h3. Problem definition

Accounts created by Agents from the Customers page use the email as the value of:
 # customer's email
 # customer's username
 # customer's full name

Therefore:
 * Agents frequently don't know their customer names because they couldn't store the user's full name on issue creation.
 * Usernames are too long strings, so customers cannot login with shorter credentials.
 * Customers cannot share tickets with other users within their organization by typing their names.

h3. Suggested solution

Build a way in which Agents can also set appropriate usernames & full names on account creation from the Customers page.
h3. Related previous suggestion

There's already a previous similar suggestion, created before 04 Jul 2016, on which the request of change had a much more limited context, as it only affected when the request security was set to 'anyone can create a customer account': JSD-1197

However, the scope change in the context makes JSD-1197 an obsolete request on Cloud instances, as now it forcibly applies to every Service Desk project in all Cloud instances.

h3. Workaround
(!) This workaround applies while creating the customer, it is still not possible to edit the existing customers.
Use our [Create Customer API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/#api-rest-servicedeskapi-customer-post] to create your customers and set their user names:
{code:html}
curl --request POST \
  --url 'https://<YourSite>.atlassian.net/rest/servicedeskapi/customer' \
  -u "email:token"\
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
  "displayName": "Test customer",
  "email": "test@test.com"
}'
{code}
* After adding the customer using the API above, *if the project is private*, you must go to the customer's page > add customer and invite them again. The API above will add them to the instance, but not to the private projects.
fields.summary: Agents should be able to set username & full name of customers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4550].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When emails contain text formatting, such as text coloring etc, the strip quote option does not appear to properly function anymore.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk project
# Add a mail channel to the project
# Create an issue through mail
# Trigger a notification to be send from JIRA towards the customer account
# The notification will contain the \{\{—Write replies above—}}. Write a reply above this line, and apply some color changes to the text in the mail

h3. Expected Results
The mail body gets added to the Service Desk request where only the text above the \{\{—Write replies above—}} gets added
h3. Actual Results
The whole body content will get added to the request, including the original notification content originating from Service Desk.
h3. Notes
In certain situations it appears duplicate comments are being created. The first comment added to the request displays only the content above the \{\{—Write replies above—}} line, whilst the "duplicate" comment adds the complete mail body.
fields.summary: Strip quotes not working on incoming mails containing text formatting

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4545].
  {panel}

Hello.
h5. Summary
 # JIRA v7.2.4
 # JIRA Service Desk Application v3.2.5
 # Confluence 6.0.2
 # Database MSSQL 2012
 # JAVA 1.8.0_112

h5. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JIRA Service Desk
 # Install Confluence 6.0.2
 # Connect Confluence + JIRA SD
 # Create KB in non-latin characters
 # Open a customer portal and try to find a non-Latin words

h5. Expected Results

The JIRA Service desk need to find items that are transferred to these words or labels in knowledge base Confluence.
h5. Actual Results

JIRA service desk in customer portal don't find non-latin label name and content in knowledge base Confluence.
h5. Notes

JIRA service desk in customer portal don't find non-latin label name and content in knowledge base Confluence. 
 For example there is an article contains the text "test тест δοκιμή Prüfvorschrift specifikace спецификация není Latin", the fat in the confluence find only words consisting entirely of the Latin letters (spetsifikatse, test, Latin), and the words "тест δοκιμή Prüfvorschrift спецификация není" will not be found.

But search directly from the confluence is working properly, and all of the search words work.

  !jira1.png|thumbnail! !jira2.png|thumbnail! !jira3.png|thumbnail! !jira4.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA service desk in customer portal don't find non-latin label name and content in knowledge base Confluence.
How can I make the "Summary" field editable for customers?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4543].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a ticket is shared with the Organisation, all users within the organisation will receive notification of the updates. This causes spam to the end users. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to disable the notification within the organisation.

h3. Workaround
Set the notification to be sent to *Reporter* only:
# Go to *Project Settings > Customer notifications*
# *Edit* the *Organization added* notification rule
# Under *To* field
#* Remove *Customers involved* 
#* Add *Reporter (customer)*

Note that this will cause all participants not receiving any notification, even they are not in the organisation but added separately.
fields.summary: Ability to Disable Notification Within Organisation
Add customer's custom fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4540].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

When SD project has Issue Collector, the unregistered emails won't be created as SD customer and the reporter will be the default reported set. It would be great if there was such configuration to allow that.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to automatically create SD customer from Issue Collector.
fields.summary: Provide a feature to automatically create SD customer from Issue Collector
Total tickets for an organization

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4538].
  {panel}

For service desk it would be useful to have the in-built processor be able to check the actual address a message was delivered to.

We operate multiple service desks each with their own email address which is attached to a distribution group that in turn delivers to a central email account (We pay a subscription fee for each mailbox in operation)

As the in-built processor works at the mailbox level rather than filtering the mailbox contents based on the address we've had to use the JIRA email handler to process tickets for our service desks but as specified in the documentation the downside is that the requests don't show up as service desk customer requests.

It would be great to be able to poll a single mailbox using the in-built processor and to be able to filter to the appropriate project based on the delivery address.
fields.summary: Support for multiple service desks each using a different email address but sharing a mailbox.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4537].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When scrolling down a ticket with lots of comments in the customer portal, the right sidebar which contains different actions stays on top, therefore, if a user who has scrolled all the way to the bottom wants to trigger an action he/she needs to go back to the top. However doing that makes user lose the context.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the right side bar "follow" as user scrolls down a page so that it will be always visible.
fields.summary: Keep the right sidebar always visible in customer portal when scrolling down the issue
Enable bulk change for accounts created by Google Integration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4535].
  {panel}

Currently in JIRA Service Desk, the SLA tracker will add a background color.
According to the documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/setting-up-slas-732528967.html

It will add a grey color when the SLA has less than 1 hour remaining. Yellow SLA has less than 30 minutes remaining and red when the SLA has breached the target.

As a Service Desk administrator, I would like to have the ability to change when these background colors will be used, so the Service Desk team can have a better view according to the priority of the requests, for example, set Yellow color when 60 minutes is remaining instead of 30.
fields.summary: Customise SLA Colors

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4534].
  {panel}

The project administrator shall be able to create customized the CSAT surveys per Issue type. The customized survey shall include questions with different types of possible answers:
 * Score (from 1 to 5 stars)
 * Single choice menu ("Very satisfied", "Satisfied", "Not happy", "Hate it"...)
 * Multiple line comment box

 

The project administrator shall be able to create reports that include the score and single choice replies. EazyBI shall import these values.

 

Thanks,

Jon
fields.summary: Multiple question CSAT survey

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4533].

h3. Problem Definition
Currently the satisfaction survey only allows a selecting stars (1-5). 
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow options for custom icons
fields.summary: Allow customized satisfaction options icons

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4532].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The current jql variables allow searching approvals and approvers as described in [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-functions-reference-764478342.html#Advancedsearching-functionsreference-approvedapproved()] document.
 JIRA however does not store the values of which users that have approved or declined a request.
The {{pending}} and {{pendingBy("")}} option only allows for issues to be displayed that still require approval, or still require approval by a defined set of users, though it is not possible to display the users themself as a function of the issues.
 Doing so would allow for reporting on this field to be put in place, as well as extend the possibilities within the issue navigator to see the actual approval status of a request
h3. Suggested Solution

Store approvers, decliners and pending approvers in a searchable field.
fields.summary: Provide a field displaying users that have approved, declined or still a pending action for a request requiring approval

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4531].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The current implementation of approvals either requires all of the approvers to provide their approval, or a fixed number out of a set of users.
In certain organisations, approval responsibility does not reside with individuals, but with groups (read, departments within the organisation).
A requirement in such an organisation could be, that in order for an approval to go through, multiple groups are required to provide their approval.
From within those groups, there are separate sets of users that can provide approval, though each group only requires to provide an "x" amount of approvals.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add an additional option in the current approval feature.
The "Get approvers from" option should not only work off a multi user picker custom field, but also a multi group picker custom field.
The "Consider approved after" option should allow for a configuration where a number of approvers per group can be set, next to the "all" option as currently available.
h3. Why this is important
Change management can rely on multiple departments within an organisation prior to changes being allowed to get pushed through.
The current implementation of the approval feature does not allow for a differentiation of user groups, reflecting these different departments within the organisation. 
h3. Workaround 
Instead of having multiple groups required to approve a request in a single step, it is possible to make several statuses and approvals per status moving the approval process from one department to another.
This is a very linear approach, and could prove to cause (several) bottlenecks to occur within the change process when one department is quicker to approve than another.
fields.summary: Add groups as a configurable entity for Approvals

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4529].

Sascha

h3. Problem Definition

When importing a ticket with a resolution set on JIRA, the SLA metrics won't stop counting for that ticket since it wasn't transitioned, which can affect metrics for customers.

h3. Suggested Solution

Imported issues should have its SLA calculated based on the date that the resolution was set.
fields.summary: SLA keeps counting when importing resolved issues on JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4523].
  {panel}

h3. h3. Problem

When messages are ignored on JIRA Service Desk, the system doesn't send a notification saying that there is a message being ignored. It would help on supporting our customers when they send invalid messages or are not listed as customers on our Service Desk.
h3. h3. Solution

Add an option to allow ignored/blocked emails to send a notification warning the instance users.
h3. h3. Workaround

Check in the Processing Tab of the mail logs at the application section of JIRA.
fields.summary: Notification when messages are ignored

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4520].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When the user exports an issue from Service desk to CSV(all fields) the "Customer Request type" do not show the actual name of the request type, instead it shows a code from it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search for service desk issue that contains not default request types
# Click on Export Excel CSV (all fields)

h3. Expected Results
On the exported csv, "Customer Request type" field shows the name of the request type.

h3. Actual Results
It shows a code from it. 
!Screen Shot 2016-11-21 at 12.08.55 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: "Customer Request type" field get encoded when exported to CSV
Email domain organization association

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4516].
  {panel}

h3. Suggestion

The ability to create a request type is shown in the JSD API documentation. The ability to get a list of request types is also included. 

This is a suggestion to add the ability to delete a request type. This is not currently included in the API documentation. 

https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/cloud/
https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/server/

h3. Notes

Deleting a request type involves an HTTP DELETE to {{BASE_URL/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/PKEY/request-types/##?undefined}} where PKEY is the project key and ## is the request type ID being deleted.
fields.summary: Add delete request type to API documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4515].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

'$\{request.status}' variable in the project template notifications does not transform into the actual status in the email notification. This affects both HTML and plain text templates
h3. Environment

JIRA Service Desk Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the $\{request.status} to your customer notification generic HTML or text template (project templates)
 # Trigger a customer notification

h3. Expected Results

$\{request.status} gets transformed into the actual ticket status in the customer notification.
h3. Actual Results

The email shows the text '$\{request.status}' instead of the actual ticket status. 
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: '${request.status}' variable in the project template notifications does not transform into the actual status in the email notification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4506].
  {panel}

h4. +Summary+
JSD-218, and JSD-4418 later on, brings a lot more flexibility in managing Customer Notifications. However, there're certain events where Customers (Reporters, Request Participants) do not receive notifications e.g. Issue Assigned, Issue Moved, Issue Updated.

h4. +Suggestion+
Add the ability to configure whether Customers should receive notifications for Issue Updated event e.g. when the Request Type is changed.

h4. +Note+
Suggestions for other Events are tracked in the linked tickets.
fields.summary: Customer Notifications for Issue Updated Event

h3. Problem Definition

h3. Suggested Solution

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4489].
  {panel}

h4. +Summary+
There're chances that an SD request is moved to a non-SD project e.g. from SD-1 to NSD-2. In this case, when accessing SD-1 via its Portal URL it says the request has been moved to a project which you have no access. This is because there's no Portal URL for NSD-2 to be redirected to.

h4. +Suggestion+
Theoretically this is a correct message. However, if NSD is open to Anonymous access, then it would be better if JIRA or SD could detect this and redirect SD-1 to the JIRA URL of NSD-2, which will be accessible by any Anonymous user.

h4. +Note+
When it comes to Anonymous, this should be tracked closely with JSD-4467.
fields.summary: Redirect a Moved Request to its JIRA URL if Portal URL is Not Available and Anonymous View is Enabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4488].
  {panel}

h2.Summary

Attachments that are embedded into comments, when sent as a notification to a JIRA Service Desk customer, are not accessible without login. Considering that most customers in JSD are created automatically because of public sign up, these customers don't really have the password to login to view these attachments directly. This problem is similar to {{https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-1361}} and is possibly a regression.

h2.Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JIRA Service Desk ticket.
# Attach an attachment to the ticket.
# Change the reporter to JIRA Service Desk customer that uses one of your emails.
# Embed said attachments in a comment via [^test.png] so that it triggers a notification to the reporter.
# When you receive the notification, copy the attachment link and load it on *private/incognito browsing'.

h2.Expected Result
Customer should be able to view the attachments without login.

h2.Current Result
Customer have to login first to view the attachments.
fields.summary: Clicking on attachments link from JSD notification requires login
Select list (single choice) field on customer portal is not accessible compliant

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4486].
  {panel}

*Suggestion*

Following the addition of the 'Organizations' feature in -JSD-270- it would be useful if we could show or hide Request Types based on what Organization the user belongs to.

*Example*

User A is set up and is added to Organization A

User B is set up and added to Organization B.

A new Request Type called Request A is set up

Permissions are added to Request A so that only Organization A can view it in the portal

This means that User A can see this Request Type when they login to the Portal, but User B cannot

*Why it would be useful*

This would be useful as we are currently dealing with multiple clients within a single Service Desk. The ability to do this would allow us to personalize a portal for each client that we have.
fields.summary: Ability to show/hide Request Types based on Organization Membership

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4485].
  {panel}

h4. Summary

In many a case customers may not beware that a Confluence KB is attached to an SD Portal. Thus, it would be great if KB articles could be displayed on Help Center to catch more attention from customers. Ideally, they can be organized into 3 columns:
* 1 for the latest KBs
* 1 for the most read KBs
* 1 for the highlighted KBs

These columns could be placed at the bottom of the Help Center.
fields.summary: Display KB articles on Help Center
Backlog trending with a cumulative flow diagram
Ability to display different Request types per group

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4481].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Customers have concerns in the way reporters and participants might be commenting on issues (e.g. by replies to email notifications) WITHOUT being aware of all the other participants on the same issue. They might have absolutely no idea that there are 5 more participants.

h3. Suggested Solution
Split the event 'Issue Commented' into 2 specific events
1) Issue Commented by JIRA user (agent, contributor,...)
2) Issue Commented by customer or participant
This would allow detailed notification settings that would let you include participants on comments of type (1) and exclude participants and/or reporters on comments of type (2).
fields.summary: Split the event 'Issue Commented' into 2 specific events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4480].
  {panel}

Hi All,

We are a tech support provider company, we have more the 200 customer with us, for each customer we have a different project to be able to track there issues and support requests. 

We mostly get tickets from them via E-mail. My suggestion is to add a email handler in JIRA SD, so that we only have one incoming & Outgoing email address setup in SD. it should sort the email with the list of customer in the project.

let me know if its possible

 

Thank you,

Regards,

Mark Khan
fields.summary: Services desk Email Handler

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4479].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

We don't have the option to track when an outgoing email sent from JIRA failed to arrive to the recipient. 

h3. Suggested Solution

To have a feature in JIRA Service Desk that allows to track which outgoing emails sent by the system were not delivered and the error that the SMTP server received

h3. Workaround 
Currently if you open a ticket with Support, they are able to track if an email did not arrive to the recipient.
fields.summary: Be able to track outgoing emails that fail to be delivered

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4476].
  {panel}

h3. Description

An automation rule configured to transition an issue upon creation may fail if the issue was created via email and contains an attachment.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a new project.
 # Configure Email Requests
 # Configure an automation rule as: WHEN Issue created -> THEN Transition issue, choosing a valid transition for the Issue Type.
 # Send an email to the address configured at Email Requests with an attachment.

h3. Expected behaviour

The issue will transition to the status configured in the THEN action.
h3. Actual behaviour

The issue history shows the expected transition, however, intermittently, the issue will not be transitioned to the new status.
fields.summary: Automation rule to transition on issue create may not transition issues raised by email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4475].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Currently, the 'Organization' field in Service Desk can be set as a required field and added to the 'Create' screen for an issue. The problem with this is that the 'Organization' selection only shows up in the Customer Portal and will not appear as a visible field in the Create screen, thus making it impossible for an admin to require an organization to be chosen, and create a Service Desk ticket through JIRA rather than the Portal. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Set 'Organization' as a required field

2. Add the field to the create screen in a Service Desk project
h3. Expected Results

The field should be visible and able to be set, or Service Desk should not allow you to set the field as required. 
h3. Actual Results

The field will only be visible in the Customer Portal and a user will not be able to create a ticket in that project through JIRA.
h3. Notes 

This might be intended functionality (as Organization is primarily a contact field and is meant as an option for customers to share a ticket with their org.), but allowing it to be set as required and put into a 'Create' screen causes confusion, as the ability implies that this field can be set through JIRA during issue creation.
fields.summary: Organization Field can be set to Required in Create Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4474].
  {panel}

We set up a project for a specific customers (Lest say Customer X). However , when providing the access link for the customer portal, this particular customer (X) can Post Tickets in other customers portals (Y, Y, Z..etc).

We wan specific access based on portal per customer. In other words, we want customer X, to be able to post/see tickets only in the portal provided.

Is that possible?

 

Thanks.
fields.summary: Customers can submit ticket to any project
Allow option to turn off private requests in Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4471].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
Currently only JIRA admins can create users without sending email invitations. Agents can only invite customers via email when public signup and outgoing mail are enabled.

h4. Suggestion
In many scenarios, it should be more convenient to allow agents to create customer accounts silently. For example agents may have talked with non-existing customers via a different communication channel so they just want to add customer accounts without disturbing admins and the customers themselves.
fields.summary: Allow Agents to Create Accounts for Customers without Sending Email Invitations
Add column showing number of users in organization

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4469].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When trying get the latest forwarded message in an incoming email and add it as a comment. A workaround that by removing "----- Forwarded message -----" and "From:" from the email and it led to a very random behaviour where sometimes email stripping works correctly, sometimes it strips everything but the first line and the email channel address.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Forward any email to JSD email channel
# Edit the subject to contain the issue key
# Remove {{---------- Forwarded message ----------}} and {{From:}}
# Send the email

h3. Expected Results
The content is added as comment.
!without_from.jpeg|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
Only the first line is added as comment.

h3.Workaround
* Remove everything that is related to email attributes, such as From, To, Date, Subject, Forwarded message and so on, before the actual email content. Just keep the email content and/or add some more info you want to it but not in the form of an email attribute. Then the email will be stripped normally.
fields.summary: Emails forwarded from Gmail don't get added to tickets as comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4468].
  {panel}

h4. Suggestion
Currently Issue Navigator supports searching with request-channel-type which shows which tickets are created from mail and which from portal. This field is however not available for Pie Chart gadget, including other Service Desk related issue field such as Customer status, Channel.

Suggestion is to make these service desk related issue fields available for Pie Chart so that admins and agents can easily compare between the usages of mail and portal for request creation:
* Request type
* Customer status
* Channel
* Insight field type
fields.summary: Add Jira Service Management related fields available as Pie Chart fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4466].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When Alert User action is used, an email will be sent as follow
!Screenshot1.jpeg|thumbnail!
Subject: <user> mentioned you on <issue key>
Content: This issue requires your attention. <list of username>

h3. Suggested Resolution
Ability to customise own content and subject.
fields.summary: Custom Message on Alert User Action

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4464].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

I would like to be able to embed our knowledge base in our customer portal so it can all be on one page, rather than a link from the portal to a separate page.

The primary goal is more visibility on what the common questions and issues are, so people can easily find the answer they are looking for *at a glance*.

Requiring customers to start typing a search doesn't resolve the issue of visibility because non-technical people are often hesitant to do it and articles won't show unless the user types in the appropriate words/phrases. IF a user does't know how to properly describe the issue but would recognize it in a list of articles, they may end up getting frustrated and create an unnecessary ticket, or leave the site entirely.
h3. Suggested Solution

To avoid having a bad user experience, I want to make the Confluence Space more readily available, such that how-to pages and FAQs are clearly listed in our Customer Portal.

Thus, I'd like to be able to embed our Confluence Space in the Customer Portal.
h3. Workaround

Educate users to visit Confluence first, and [configure a banner associated with the Knowledge Base space|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-add-a-space-wide-banner-717062877.html] referring users to the Customer Portal if they can't find the answer to their question.
fields.summary: As an administrator I want to be able to embed my knowledge base into the customer portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4462].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, adding request type to SLA goals is only possible using the 'project key/request type' combo which is counter intuitive as users would not be able to select them without viewing the exact string stored in database
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow using the Request Type string 
eg : "Get IT Help"
h3. Workaround
Use the exact string used in database eg: "project-key/get-it-help"
For JIRA Cloud customers, please contact support for the 'project key/request type' combo
fields.summary: Allow configuring Request Type in SLA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4461].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
At the moment, it's not possible for automation to be triggered upon custom events

h3. Suggestion 
Allow admins to select custom events to trigger automations

h3. Example
# JIRA allow admins to change the post function of transitions. If admins change the event triggered from issue creation to something other than the Issue Created event, the default automation wouldn't work
# In other scenarios, admin may have heavily modified their workflow with many custom events and would need the automation to perform action based on these events
fields.summary: Automation trigger on custom events
test

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4458].
  {panel}

JSD calendars are useful for enforcing non-24hr hours of operation.  However, they fail to take account of when an organisation operates in a location with daylight saving time. 

For instance a contract may specify 9am - 6pm for support. However the server time does not change to reflect daylight saving time. Therefore for part of the year the SLA calendar will not align with the contract hours.

I discussed this at Summit 2016 with Vidhu, Lingbo and Adriana.  Please contact me direct for a PoC. 

A partial workaround is to use the created time to determine which SLA calendar to use and define summer and winter calendars. I am about to publish a blog post on this workaround and will add a comment when I have the url.
fields.summary: Handle Daylight Saving Time in JSD Calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4457].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Request types can be organized into [Groups|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/configuring-the-customer-portal-732528918.html#Configuringthecustomerportal-setUpRequestTypesSetuprequesttypes]. In some situations, each group should have a request type named *Other* for requests part of the group which doesn't have an exact request type for it

As an admin, I would like to know which group each request is from. This is currently possible by creating a *Other* request type in each group. This means if we have 10 groups, we need 10 different request types. This is tedious and would be best if we can re-use the same request type for all groups, but SD automatically tracks this information

h3. Suggestion
Track the group information for each request created
fields.summary: Track request type "Group" information

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4452].
  {panel}

I gen an error message when I set browse project permission to anyone.

I need this in my JIRA to show in public list of tickets being worked on.

Message is annoying when accessing project every time.

"This service desk project has configuration problems and may not work as expected."

Unless you resolve JSD-4390 you should not prompt this.
fields.summary: Add a possibility to hide error message

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4451].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The customer would like to be able to hide the "Customer Channel" session from the sidebar, so that his agents shouldn't see the links to his portal. Screen below

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Have an option to remove it from the UI 

h3. Workaround 
While in cloud, found no suitable workaround
(Optional)
fields.summary: Be able to hide Customer Channels from the UI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4450].
  {panel}

Hi, would love to have the option to organize the admin section for request types by groups
 ex:
 group1
 - report a system problem
 - get IT help

group2
 - foo
 - foo2
 - foo3

or perhaps something graphic would be cool too

either or, you rock Atlassian! Can't wait for the Summit next year!
fields.summary: Request type grouping
Custom Role names and administration role

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4448].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Currently the custom report displays fixed columns with limited information. (key, request summary, reporter, assignee, request type and status)

h3.Suggestion
It should be possible to customize the report with more columns e.g. component, insight custom field (CMDB / service category), date, etc.
fields.summary: Ability to Add more Columns / custom fields to custom report drill-down table
Organization LDAP integration
Ability to hide Create button based on project or signed in users group

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4444].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When moving a ticket from a workflow that requires approval to another that does not, the approval need will not be removed, even though the target workflow does not use it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Modify the workflow from an issue type on a Service Desk Project to require approval, and have at least one issue type on the same project that does not have approval as part of the workflow.
# Create a ticket on the issue type that needs approval
# Move the ticket to the issue type that does not require approval

h3. Expected Results

The approval need is removed.

h3. Actual Results

The ticket will still need to be approved.

h3.Workaround

*Update (23/10/2017)*: The provided workaround in this bug report is only applicable to Server instances only and has been removed. There is no known workaround.
fields.summary: Moving a ticket won't remove approval need

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4443].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

At this point Service Desk does not offer the option to change or remove the announcement logo shown in the customer portal

 !Pasted_Image_27_10_16_12_02.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Have an option to customize or remove the logo
fields.summary: Ability to change or remove the announcement logo in the customer portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4441].
  {panel}

+Suggestion Summary+

Currently in Service Desk, when an agent attempts to invite a user as a participant and the email does not exist yet, the user cannot be selected or invited.

+How to Verify+

# Go to {{Project > SD Project > Issue}} as an agent.
# Type in an email of a user that is not a customer in the request participant field.

+Expected Result+

JIRA should trigger an invite to the user to join Service Desk and also alert him he has been invited as a participant.

+Actual Result+

JIRA would let the agent know that the user does not exist hence he cannot be added to the field.

+Work Aroundt+
* Click on *view customer request* link on view issue screen in right-panel in *Service Desk request* section.
* Add request participant there by clicking on *Share* link.
fields.summary: Allow Agents to Request Participants via Email that do not belong to customer
Default language

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4439].
  {panel}

I work with three (3) projects and do some reporting on Satisfaction from each. 

At present I have to go to each projects _Satisfaction_ page, do a copy of the data to a spread sheet, and then do some summing to get the overall satisfaction from the 3 projects.

It would be good to be able to create a custom report that reports from all 3 projects in one go.

Also would like to create a custom report per JSD-4293.
fields.summary: Report Satisfaction across projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4438].
  {panel}

The Service Desk Reporting creates tables with names that exceed the Oracle naming limit of 30 bytes, resulting in ORA-00972:
* http://docs.oracle.com/cd/B28359_01/server.111/b28286/sql_elements008.htm#sthref727

Example name:
* AO_0201F0_KB_HELPFUL_ARTICLE_AGGR

This will fail for any customers running Oracle db.
fields.summary: Service Desk Reports Plugin causes ORA-00972

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4436].
  {panel}

We would like to be able to add screenshots directly inline from the description field in the Customer Portal.  You can now do this from within JIRA itself which is nice and you can now paste screenshots in the portal (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-725) which is also nice but the use case we have is for customers who are trying to describe something using screenshots.  

For instance, customer comes to the Service Desk portal and starts creating a ticket.  In the description they want to say:
I can't log in.  Here is a screenshot of the login screen:
(screenshot of login screen)
When I supply my username and password I get this error:
(screenshot of the error screen)

Today you cannot do this from the Customer Portal.  You can attach images but you cannot easily relate those images to the text in the description.
fields.summary: Attachments/Screenshots in the description from the Customer Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4433].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
If you use a URL custom field and make it visible on the Customer Portal it will display as text instead of as a clickable link.

When viewed in JIRA as an agent, however, the link is rendered as clickable. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Update renderer for URL Custom Fields such that the links are clickable in Portal View.

h3. Workaround 
Instead of using a URL custom field type, you could use a Text (Single Line) custom field with the Renderer set to *Wiki Style Renderer*.  This will correctly render URLs as clickable, however it won't perform input validation to ensure you are entering a URL.
fields.summary: Render URL Custom Fields as Links in Customer Portal
Add ability to add alt text to an image for Section 508 Compliance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4430].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently there is no option for customer to choose Italian as the default language and set up customer notifications in Italian

h3. Suggested Solution

Add Italian as an additional language for customers
fields.summary: Add Italian translation for customer notifications
Mobile app

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4427].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Right now the only way to know if an incoming email sent to any of the JIRA Service Desk inboxes failed to create a ticket is in the Administration section of JIRA and checking the processing box of each of the inboxes. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Set up a contact/s to receive an email notification when an incoming email gets rejected and a ticket is not created
fields.summary: Get notifications on incoming emails that fail to create a ticket
